Lab Panel

Chat with an AI research agent grounded in your sources. Get recommendations with transparent reasoning and full citations back to authoritative documentation.

LangGraph-powered multi-step reasoning

Scenarios

Stacks

Configure your AI infrastructure with model selection, hardware preferences, and framework choices. Get AI-suggested stacks optimized for your scenario.

Model selection (Claude, GPT-4, Gemini)
Hardware preferences (A100, H100, L40S)
Framework configuration (vLLM, TensorRT)
AI-suggested stack recommendations

Three-Panel Interface for AI Research

Lattice combines knowledge management, AI-powered analysis, and artifact generation in a unified interface designed for AI infrastructure decisions.

Sources Panel

Multi-source knowledge ingestion with hybrid semantic and keyword search. Every recommendation links back to specific source chunks.

  • PDFs, URLs, GitHub, YouTube, Google Docs
  • Real-time indexing with chunk counting
  • Citation tracking to source documents

Lab Panel

LangGraph-powered research agent with transparent reasoning. Get grounded recommendations citing specific source chunks.

  • Multi-step reasoning with thinking traces
  • Conversation-to-scenario extraction
  • @ mentions for source references

Studio Panel

Save chat responses as reusable artifacts. Generate tables, comparisons, and decision documents for stakeholder review.

  • Save responses as named artifacts
  • Export to CSV, JSON, Markdown
  • Track artifact history and versions

36 Curated Blueprints

Pre-built knowledge bundles from Anthropic, AWS, NVIDIA, GCP, Meta, and Mistral. One-click workspace population.

  • Vendor documentation pre-packaged
  • Pre-configured scenarios and stacks
  • AI-powered blueprint discovery

Scenario Configuration

Define workload types, SLO requirements, budget constraints, and compliance needs. Get stack recommendations that match.

  • Chat, RAG, Agentic, Embedding workloads
  • Latency, throughput, availability targets
  • SOC2, HIPAA, GDPR compliance

Stack Management

Configure model providers, framework selection, and hardware options. Pre-built stack templates for common patterns.

  • LangGraph, LangChain, custom frameworks
  • Cloud provider and region selection
  • GPU type and instance sizing

Built for AI Infrastructure Decisions

Lattice helps research engineers, platform leads, and CTOs make confident decisions with grounded recommendations and full citations.

Research Engineers

"I need to evaluate three embedding models for our RAG pipeline. I want to compare accuracy, latency, and cost—with citations to actual benchmark data."

With Lattice:

Upload papers, pricing docs, model cards. Get comparison tables with full provenance.

Platform Leads

"My team needs a recommendation for which LLM provider to use. I need to factor in latency requirements, budget, and compliance needs."

With Lattice:

Configure scenarios with SLOs, budget, compliance. Get stack recommendations meeting all constraints.

CTOs & Technical Leaders

"I need to present our AI infrastructure strategy to the board. I want clear cost projections and vendor comparisons."

With Lattice:

Generate executive-ready artifacts. Track decision provenance back to sources.

Simple, One-Time Pricing

Get lifetime access to Lattice with a single purchase. No subscriptions, no recurring fees.

$99
One-time payment • Lifetime access
  • Full access to Sources, Lab, and Studio panels
  • 36 curated vendor blueprints (Anthropic, AWS, NVIDIA, GCP, Meta, Mistral)
  • Unlimited workspaces and source ingestion
  • Scenario configuration with SLOs, budget, and compliance
  • Artifact generation and export (CSV, JSON, Markdown)
  • All future updates included

Note: You'll need your own API keys for LLM providers (Anthropic, OpenAI, etc.). Typical usage costs $3-15/month depending on volume.

Frequently Asked Questions

Lattice is an agentic AI lab assistant that helps research engineers, platform leads, and CTOs make confident AI infrastructure decisions. It automates research synthesis by processing vendor documentation, benchmarks, and pricing data—providing grounded recommendations with full citations back to authoritative sources.

Unlike general-purpose AI assistants, Lattice is purpose-built for AI infrastructure research. It ingests your specific sources (vendor docs, papers, pricing pages), maintains citation chains, and provides recommendations grounded in your curated knowledge base—not generic training data. Every claim links back to a specific source chunk you can verify.

Blueprints are curated knowledge bundles that package vendor documentation, pre-configured scenarios, and recommended stacks. Lattice includes 36 blueprints from leading vendors like Anthropic, AWS, NVIDIA, GCP, Meta, and Mistral. Apply a blueprint to instantly populate your workspace with relevant sources and configurations.

Yes, Lattice uses your own API keys for LLM providers (Anthropic, OpenAI, Google). This keeps your data private and gives you full control over usage costs. Typical monthly API costs range from $3-15 depending on usage volume.

Lattice supports multiple source types: PDF documents, web URLs, GitHub repositories, YouTube video transcripts, and Google Docs. All content is chunked, embedded, and indexed for semantic search. Citations track back to specific chunks in your sources.

A scenario defines your workload requirements: workload type (Chat, RAG, Agentic, Embedding), SLO requirements (latency P50/P95/P99, throughput, availability), budget constraints, and compliance needs (regions, certifications like SOC2/HIPAA/GDPR). Lattice uses scenarios to recommend appropriate stacks.

A stack is a configuration that includes: model (provider, model ID, temperature, context length), framework (LangGraph, LangChain, custom), and hardware (cloud provider, region, GPU type, instance sizing). Stacks are recommended based on your scenario requirements.

Yes. Your sources are processed locally and stored in your own database. API calls to LLM providers use your own keys and are subject to their privacy policies. Lattice doesn't share your research data with third parties.

The one-time $99 purchase includes lifetime access to Lattice: all three panels (Sources, Lab, Studio), 36 curated blueprints, unlimited workspaces, scenario and stack configuration, artifact generation and export, and all future updates. No subscriptions or recurring fees.
